item.title: Honoring America's Veterans and Caring for Camp Lejeune Families Act of 2012

item.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection. (text: CR H5552)
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.(text: CR H5552)
Mr. Miller (FL) asked unanimous consent to take from the Speaker's table and consider.
Considered by unanimous consent. (consideration: CR H5552)
Message on Senate action sent to the House.

Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S5824-5825; text as passed Senate: CR S5824-5825; text of measure as introduced: CR S5824-5825)

Passed/agreed to in Senate: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment by Unanimous Consent.(consideration: CR S5824-5825; text as passed Senate: CR S5824-5825; text of measure as introduced: CR S5824-5825)

summary.text: Directs the Clerk of the House of Representatives to make a correction in the enrollment of H.R. 1627 (furnishing hospital care and medical services to veterans who were stationed at Camp Lejeune, North Carolina, while the water was contaminated there and to improve the provision of housing assistance to veterans and their families) by changing the spelling of a last name in the short title of title II.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Directs the Clerk of the House of Representatives to make a correction in the enrollment of H.R. 1627 (furnishing hospital care and medical services to veterans who were stationed at Camp Lejeune, North Carolina, while the water was contaminated there, and to improve the provision of housing assistance to veterans and their families) by changing the spelling of a last name in the short title of title II.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Directs the Clerk of the House of Representatives to make a correction in the enrollment of H.R. 1627 (furnishing hospital care and medical services to veterans who were stationed at Camp Lejeune, North Carolina, while the water was contaminated there and to improve the provision of housing assistance to veterans and their families) by changing the spelling of a last name in the short title of title II.

bill.title: A concurrent resolution directing the Clerk of the House of Representatives to make a correction in the enrollment of H.R. 1627.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
